theoryOfChange: By providing authentic knowledge through native speakers and structured curriculum, the institute aims to help students live by the Quran and strengthen their faith.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Cause IQ page for Ar-Rahman Learning Center in Chicago, IL, describes its activities as providing religious knowledge, daily prayer, weekly sermons, congregational prayer, and classes, as well as organizing book fairs and marriage ceremonies. strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="5">84.1% of its expenses toward program services</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are utilized for mission-critical activities.
The charity spends <cite id="6">$0.00 to raise every $1 in revenue</cite>, which is significantly better than industry standards for humanitarian organizations.
With <cite id="7">785.8 months of working capital in working capital</cite>, the organization has a massive safety net to sustain long-term operations.

strengths_deep_dive: AR-Rahman Learning Center Inc demonstrates a unique financial profile characterized by <cite id="3">$4,559,370 in total revenue</cite> derived entirely from contributions. Its ability to maintain a <cite id="5">84.1% program expense ratio</cite> is a notable indicator of lean administrative operations. Furthermore, the organization's <cite id="4">4242.3% revenue growth</cite> over the last three years suggests a rapidly expanding donor base and organizational capacity to scale its <cite id="2">educational and social welfare programs</cite> globally.
rich_narrative.summary: AR-Rahman Learning Center Inc is a US-based non-profit organization focused on providing <cite id="1">affordable humanitarian services in education, healthcare, and social welfare</cite>. The organization operates with a global geographic reach, offering specialized educational programs such as <cite id="2">Quran classes, Arabic language studies, and Islamic studies</cite> through both private and group instruction. In the 2023 tax year, the organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $4,559,370</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="4">three-year revenue CAGR of 4242.3%</cite>. This rapid growth is paired with a high <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 84.1%</cite> according to recent tax filings, indicating that all reported expenses are directed toward its core mission. While the organization maintains <cite id="6">exceptional fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, it also holds a substantial <cite id="7">working capital reserve of 785.8 months</cite>, suggesting a high level of financial stability but also a potential for increased deployment of funds into direct services.
